plants.name: Echinacea purpurea
plants.description: A hardy perennial native to North America, known for its large, purple-pink daisy-like flowers with a spiny central cone. It attracts pollinators like bees and butterflies.
plants.funFact: Echinacea is often used in herbal remedies believed to boost the immune system.

plants.name: Hibiscus rosa-sinensis
plants.description: A tropical shrub that produces large, showy flowers with a prominent stamen. It blooms prolifically in warm climates, adding vibrant color to gardens.
plants.funFact: Hibiscus flowers are edible and used to make refreshing teas and beverages.

plants.name: Camellia sasanqua
plants.description: An evergreen shrub that blooms in early fall, producing smaller but fragrant flowers compared to other camellias, often used in ornamental gardens.
plants.location: Native to Japan, cultivated in mild climates
plants.funFact: Sasanqua camellias bloom earlier in the season than other camellia species, heralding the arrival of autumn.
